item.title: Quill - Your powerful rich text editor
item.description: Quill is a free, open source WYSIWYG editor built for the modern web. Completely customize it for any need with its modular architecture and expressive API.

item.title: Introduction to Distributed Tracing With OpenTelemetry in .NET
item.description: Distributed systems offer flexibility but introduce complexity, making troubleshooting a headache. Understanding how requests flow through your system is crucial for debugging and performance optimization. OpenTelemetry is an open-source observability framework that makes this possible.
item.author: (Milan JovanoviÄ‡)

item.description: Abandoning the background work if we know that it is pointless.

item.title: Supabase Storage: now supports the S3 protocol
item.description: Supabase Storage is now officially an S3-Compatible Storage Provider.

item.title: AI Hype - Am I out of work in five years?
item.description: AI is a hot topic - one would say hype topic, and there are bold claims like this: There Will Be No (Human) Programmers in Five Years Source: https://decrypt.co/147191/no-human-programmers-five-years-ai-stability-ceo Now how far is this from reality? Let's take a look at the current state of AI in the context of programming.
